name: Judge Paul Scovil
body: 282 NOVEMBER 21, 2024 2024-282 Under subsection 4.5(1) of the Provincial Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the Honourable Judge Paul Scovil of the Provincial Court of Nova Scotia to preside over the following matter: a) on or about May 21, 2024 at or near Miramichi, New Brunswick, Stein Mason Anderson did commit an assault on Provincial Court Judge Johanne-Marguerite Landry, thereby committing an offence, contrary to and in violation of paragraph 266(b) of the Criminal Code (Canada) and amendments thereto; b) on or about May 21, 2024 at or near Miramichi, New Brunswick, Stein Mason Anderson did, without lawful authority, engage in conduct, to wit: jumped and spat over the plexiglass divider towards the dais where Judge Johanne-Marguerite Landry was seated, with intent to provoke a state of fear in a justice system participant, namely Judge Johanne-Marguerite Landry in order to impede that person in the performance of her duties, thereby committing an indictable offence, contrary to section 423.1(3) of the Criminal Code (Canada) and amendments thereto; and 282 c) on or about May 21, 2024 at or near Miramichi, New Brunswick, Stein Mason Anderson did willfully damage the Judge’s robe, property of Provincial Court Judge Johanne-Marguerite Landry, the value of which did not exceed five thousand dollars, and thereby committing mischief, an indictable offence, contrary to section 430(4)(a) of the Criminal Code (Canada) and amendments thereto. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the (Bee de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 21 November 2024. name: David Charles Hickey
body: 271 NOVEMBER 2, 2024 2024-271 Under section 1 of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant- Governor appoints the following persons as members of the Executive Council, effective November 2, 2024: (a) Susan Catherine Holt, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Fredericton South-Silverwood; name: Chuck Chiasson
body: 272 NOVEMBER 2, 2024 2024-272 Under section 2 of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant- Governor appoints under the Great Seal of the Province, from among the members of the Executive Council, the following Ministers who shall hold office during pleasure, effective November 2, 2024: (a) The Honourable Susan Catherine Holt, Premier and President of the Executive Council; (b) The Honourable René Michel Legacy, Minister of Finance and Treasury Board; (c) The Honourable Robert Gauvin, Minister of Public Safety; (d) The Honourable Pat Finnigan, Minister of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries; (e) The Honourable Claire Johnson, Minister of Education and Early Childhood Development; (f) The Honourable Gilles LePage, Minister of Environment and Climate Change; (g) The Honourable Aaron Blake Kennedy, Minister of Local _ Government; (h) The Honourable John Michael Dornan, Minister of Health; -2- 272 (i) The Honourable Robert McKee, Minister of Justice who shall also be Attorney General; (j) The Honourable Keith Chiasson, Minister of Indigenous Affairs; (k) The Honourable Alyson Jean Townsend, Minister of Post- Secondary Education, Training and Labour; (I) The Honourable Cynthia Miles, Minister of Social Development; (m) The Honourable Isabelle Thériault, Minister of Tourism, Heritage and Culture; and (n) The Honourable Chuck Chiasson, Minister of Transportation and Infrastructure. Az Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 2 November 2024. name: Chuck Chiasson
body: 271 NOVEMBER 2, 2024 2024-271 Under section 1 of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant- Governor appoints the following persons as members of the Executive Council, effective November 2, 2024: (a) Susan Catherine Holt, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Fredericton South-Silverwood; {b) René Michel Legacy, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Bathurst; (c) Jean-Claude D’Amours, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Edmunston-Vallée-des- Riviéres; (d) Robert Gauvin, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Shediac Bay-Dieppe; (e) Lyne Chantal Boudreau, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Champdoré-lrishtown; (f) Pat Finnigan,a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Kent North; (g) Claire Johnson, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Moncton South; (h) Gilles LePage, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Restigouche West; 271 (i) Aaron Blake Kennedy, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Quispamsis; (j) John Michael Dornan, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Saint John Portland-Simonds; (k) Robert McKee, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Moncton Centre; (1) Keith Chiasson, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Tracadie; (m) John Patrick Herron, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Hampton-Fundy-St. Martins; (n) Joshua Luke Randall, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Fredericton North; (o) Alyson Jean Townsend, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Rothesay; (p) Cynthia Miles, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district Hanwell-New Maryland; (q) David Charles Hickey, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Saint John Harbour; (r) Isabelle Thériault, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Caraquet; and 271 (s) Chuck Chiasson, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Grand Falls-Vallée-des-Riviéres-Saint- Quentin. pe Brenda L. body: 267 SEPTEMBER 10, 2024 2024-267 1. Under subsection 7(1) of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Dr. Ann Collins of Fredericton, New Brunswick as a member of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council, effective September 10, 2024, for a term of two years. 2. Under subsection 7(1) of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Céline Robichaud-Trifts of Moncton, New Brunswick as a member of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council, effective September 10, 2024, for a term of two years. 3. Under subsection 7(1) of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Joanna Martin of Dalhousie, New Brunswick as a member of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council, effective September 10, 2024, for a term of two years. 4. Under subsection 7(1) of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Lisa Snodgrass of Hampton, New Brunswick as a member of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council, effective September 10, 2024, for a term of three years. 5. Under subsection 7(1) of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Madeleine Dubé of Edmundston, New Brunswick as a member of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council, effective September 10, 2024, for a term of three years. 267 6. Under subsection 7(1) of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Diane Carey of Tracadie, New Brunswick as a member of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council, effective September 10, 2024, for a term of three years. pu ~ps, Brenda L. name: Christian Whalen
body: 261 SEPTEMBER 10, 2024 2024-261 1. Under subsection 2(1) of the Public Trustee Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Christian Whalen of Island View, New Brunswick, as the Public Trustee, effective November 4, 2024, for a term of five years. 2. : Under section 15 of the Civil Service Act, section 2 of the Public Trustee Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council revokes section 1 of Order in Council 2011-357 dated December 1, 2011, effective November 3, 2024. Brenda L. Under subsection 4(5) of the Energy and Utilities Board Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of the skills and qualifications required of the New Brunswick Energy and Utilities Board as a whole to carry out its functions, the skills and qualifications required of the candidates for the positions on the New Brunswick Energy and Utilities Board, as well as the nominating committee’s comments and recommendations pertaining to candidates. 2. Under paragraph 4(4)(d) of the Energy and Utilities Board Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of a description of the recruitment, assessment and selection processes used and the results of those processes. 3. Under paragraph 4(1)(a) and subsection 5(1) of the Energy and Utilities Board Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council appoints Kenneth B. McCullogh, K.C. of Rothesay, New Brunswick, as a full-time member of the New Brunswick Energy and Utilities Board, effective July 9, 2024, for a term of ten years. wale Brenda L. name: Gary Mersereau
body: 167 JUNE 27, 2024 2024-167 | Under subsections 58(3) and 60(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Brigette Ouellette of Grand-Sault, New Brunswick, as a Vice-Chair of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal, effective June 27, 2024, for a term of five years. 2. Under paragraph 58(1)(b) and subsection 60(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Monica Plourde of Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal, from Region A, effective ‘June 27, 2024, for a term of three years. 3... _—-—-Under subsections 58(2) and 60(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Gary Mersereau of Fredericton Junction, New Brunswick, as an alternate member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal, from Region E, effective June 27, 2024, for a term of three years. 4. Under paragraph 58(1)(b) and subsection 60(2) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Paul G. Chiasson of Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal, from Region B, effective June 27, 2024, for a term of three years. 5. Under paragraph 58(1)(b) and subsection 60(2) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints (Tracy) Denise Cassidy of Norton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal, from Region D, effective July 10, 2024, for a term of three years. 167 6. Under section 61 of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council determines the remuneration for members and alternate members of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal as follows: a) $160 for a day of four hours or more; and b) $80 for a day of less than four hours. 7. Under section 61 of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council fixes the rate for reimbursement of expenses incurred by the Vice-Chairs, members and alternate members of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal while acting on behalf of the Tribunal, in accordance with Government of New Brunswick Administration Manual Policy AD-2801. u K Brenda L. Murphy rd Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the Yunw o? de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 27 June 2024. - Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet

body: 167 JUNE 27, 2024 2024-167 | Under subsections 58(3) and 60(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Brigette Ouellette of Grand-Sault, New Brunswick, as a Vice-Chair of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal, effective June 27, 2024, for a term of five years. 2. Under paragraph 58(1)(b) and subsection 60(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Monica Plourde of Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal, from Region A, effective ‘June 27, 2024, for a term of three years. 3... _—-—-Under subsections 58(2) and 60(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Gary Mersereau of Fredericton Junction, New Brunswick, as an alternate member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal, from Region E, effective June 27, 2024, for a term of three years. 4. name: Geneviéve Latour
body: 155 JUNE 20, 2024 2024-155 1. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsections 5(2) and 5(5) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Regroupement féministe du Nouveau-Brunswick, as a member organization, represented by Geneviéve Latour of Rogersville, New Brunswick, to the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of three years. 2. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsections 5(2) and 5(5) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints YWCA Moncton, as a member organization, represented by Michéle. Nadeau of Shediac, New Brunswick, to the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of three years. 3. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsections 5(2) and 5(5) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Alter Acadie, as a member organization, represented by Emily Muckler of Moncton, New Brunswick, to the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of three years. 4. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsections 5(2) and 5(5) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints University of New Brunswick Nursing Faculty, as a member organization, represented by Patricia Morris of Fredericton, New Brunswick, to the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of three years. -2- 155 5. Under paragraph 5(1}(c) and subsections 5(2) and 5(5) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Tiffany Mirzica of Moncton, New Brunswick, as a member to the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of three years. 6. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsections 5(2) and 5(5) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Sexual Violence New Brunswick, as a member organization, represented by Jennifer Richard of Dieppe, New Brunswick, to the New Brunswick's Women’s Council, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of three years. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the Kings Landing Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Tommy Dixon of Perth Andover, New Brunswick, as a Director of the Kings Landing Corporation, effective June 6, 2024, for a term of two years. 3. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the Kings Landing Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Susan Knight of Upper Kingsclear, New Brunswick, as a Director of the Kings Landing Corporation, effective June 6, 2024, for a term of one year. 5. name: Melanie Patrick
position: Clerk of the Court of King's Bench of New Brunswick - Trial Division and Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick
body: 137 JUNE 6, 2024 2024-137 1. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Anthony Coulombe of Campbellton, New Brunswick, as a Clerk of the Court of King's Bench of New Brunswick - Trial Division, Administrator of the Court of King's Bench of New Brunswick - Family Division and Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District of Campbellton, effective June 6, 2024. 2. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Stephanie Pelletier of Saint-Basile, New Brunswick, as a Clerokf the Court of King's Bench of New Brunswick - Trial Division, Administrator of the Court of King's Bench of New Brunswick - Family Division and Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District of Edmundston, effective June 6, 2024. 3. Under subsection 68(1) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Melanie Patrick of Hampton, New Brunswick, as Clerk of the Court of King's Bench of New Brunswick - Trial Division and Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District-of Saint John, effective June 6, 2024. 137 4. Under subsection 68(1) of the Judicature Act, subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 1 of Order in Council 2024- 49 dated March 12, 2024. A Weps Brenda L. name: John P. Logan
body: 119 MAY 16, 2024 2024-119 1. Under subsection 4(5) of the Energy and Utilities Board Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of the skills and qualifications required of the New Brunswick Energy and Utilities Board as a whole to carry out its functions, the skills and qualifications required of the candidates for the positions on the Board, and the Board’s comments and recommendations pertaining to candidates. 2. Under paragraph 4(4)(d) of the Energy and Utilities Board Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of a description of the recruitment, assessment and selection processes used and the results of those processes. 3. Under paragraph 4(1)(b) and subsection 5(1) of the Energy and Utilities Board Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council appoints John P. Logan of Quispamsis, New Brunswick, as a part-time member of the New Brunswick Energy and Utilities Board, effective May 16, 2024, for a term of five years. 4. Under section 7 of the Energy and Utilities Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council determines the remuneration for part-time members of the New Brunswick Energy and Utilities Board be set in the amount of an annual stipend of $5000, and per diems of $500 for four hours or more and $250 for less than four hours. name: Stephen Manuel
body: 111 MAY 2, 2024 2024-111 Under section 61 of the Control of Municipalities Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2024-32 dated February 15, 2024, effective May 15, 2024, and: a) The Municipality of Lakeland Ridges ceases to be subject to the provisions of Part V of the Control of Municipalities Act, and the supervisor appointed by Order in Council 2024-32 no longer exercises jurisdiction and control over the municipality; and b = Stephen Manuel, supervisor of the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges, ceases to have the authority to take full charge and control over all money belonging to the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges and received by any person for or on its behalf, and ceases to have the authority to sign all cheques drawn and issued by the municipality, and that any person previously authorized to countersign cheques ceases to have the authority to countersign cheques with Stephen Manuel as set out in Order in Council 2024-32. Brenda L. name: Scott Northard
body: 92 APRIL 18, 2024 2024-92 1. Under subsection15(6) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of a description of the skills and qualifications required of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation as a whole in order for the Board to carry out its functions, and the skills and qualification requirements for nominees for the Board of Directors positions to be filled. 2. Under paragraph 15(7)(c) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of a description of the recruitment, assessment and selection processes used by the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation in making nominations and the results of those processes. 3. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsections 15(3) and 15(5) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Wayne Power of Rothesay, New Brunswick, as a Director of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 18, 2024, for a term of three years. 4. , Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsections 15(3) and 15(5) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Patrick Oland of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a Director of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 18, 2024, for a term of three years. 5. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsection 15(8) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Chantal Cormier of Moncton, New Brunswick, as a Director of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 18, 2024, for a term of four years. 92 6. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsection 15(8) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Paul McCoy of Western Springs, Illinois, United States of America, as a Director of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 18, 2024, for a term of four years. 7. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsection 15(8) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Scott Northard of Hastings, Minnesota, United States of America, as a Director of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 18, 2024, for a term of three years. 8. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsection 15(8) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Nancy Whipp of Shediac, New Brunswick, as a Director of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 18, 2024, for a term of one year. f) ry. YY) - Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the . de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 18 April 2024. Chal eus Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet

Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsections 15(3) and 15(5) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Wayne Power of Rothesay, New Brunswick, as a Director of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 18, 2024, for a term of three years. 4. , Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsections 15(3) and 15(5) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Patrick Oland of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a Director of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 18, 2024, for a term of three years. 5. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsection 15(8) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Chantal Cormier of Moncton, New Brunswick, as a Director of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 18, 2024, for a term of four years. 92 6. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsection 15(8) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Paul McCoy of Western Springs, Illinois, United States of America, as a Director of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 18, 2024, for a term of four years. 7. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsection 15(8) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Scott Northard of Hastings, Minnesota, United States of America, as a Director of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 18, 2024, for a term of three years. 8. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsection 15(8) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Nancy Whipp of Shediac, New Brunswick, as a Director of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 18, 2024, for a term of one year. f) ry. name: Rino Volpé
body: 85 APRIL 10, 2024 2024-85 1. Under subsections 7(1) and 7(1.1) of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Rino Volpé of Saint-Jacques, New Brunswick, as a member and Chair of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council, effective April 10, 2024, for a term of one year. 2. Under subsection 8(1) of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council determines the remuneration and fixes the rate for reimbursement of expenses for members of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council, as follows: a) the Chair shall be remunerated in the amount of $20,000 per annum, and b) the Chair and members shall be remunerated in the amount of $500 per day, or $250 per half day, or part thereof while performing duties of the Council, and shall be reimbursed for travel and living expenses incurred in the performance of their duties in accordance with the Government of New Brunswick Travel Directive AD-2801. Brenda L. name: Donna Redmond Gates
body: 82 APRIL 4, 2024 1. Under paragraph 5(1)(b).and subsection 5(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Jacques Dubé of Bathurst, New Brunswick, as a member and Vice- Chairperson of the Local Governance Commission, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of three years. 2.0 Under paragraph 5(1)(b) and subsection. 5(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Troy Stone of Bath, New Brunswick, as a member of the Local Governance Commission, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of five years. 3. Under paragraph 5(1)(b) and subsection 5(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints John Nugent of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member of the Local Governance Commission, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of five years. 4. Under paragraph 5(1})(b) and subsection 5{3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Donna Redmond Gates of Quispamsis, New Brunswick, as a member of the Local Governance Commission, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of three years. -2- 82 5. Under section 8 of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council determines the remuneration for the Vice- Chairperson and members of the Local Governance Commission as follows: a) $200 for a day of four hours or more; b) $100 for a day of less than four hours; and c) $400 for a day when the Vice-Chairperson acts in absence of the Chairperson; or d) $200 for a day of less than four hours when the Vice-Chairperson acts in absence of the Chairperson. 6. Under section 8 of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council fixes the rate for reimbursement of expenses incurred by the Vice-Chairperson and members of the Local Governance Commission while acting on behalf of the Commission in accordance with Government of New Brunswick Administration Manual Policy AD-2801. Brenda L. Under paragraphs 3(1)(c) and 3(2)(a) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Brent Thompson of Rothesay, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, representing forest industries of New Brunswick, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of three years. 3. Under paragraph 3(1)(d), and subsections 4(1) and 4(3) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Peter MacNutt of Richibucto Road, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, representing the Department of Natural Resources and Energy Development, effective April 4, 2024, for a term ending September 25, 2025. 4. Under paragraphs 3(1)(d) and 3(2)(b) of the Forest Products Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 2 of Order in Council 2022-172 dated June 23, 2022. Under paragraph 3(1)(d), and subsections 4(1) and 4(3) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Peter MacNutt of Richibucto Road, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, representing the Department of Natural Resources and Energy Development, effective April 4, 2024, for a term ending September 25, 2025. 4. Under paragraphs 3(1)(d) and 3(2)(b) of the Forest Products Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 2 of Order in Council 2022-172 dated June 23, 2022. name: Troy Stone
body: 82 APRIL 4, 2024 1. Under paragraph 5(1)(b).and subsection 5(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Jacques Dubé of Bathurst, New Brunswick, as a member and Vice- Chairperson of the Local Governance Commission, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of three years. 2.0 Under paragraph 5(1)(b) and subsection. 5(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Troy Stone of Bath, New Brunswick, as a member of the Local Governance Commission, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of five years. 3. Under paragraph 5(1)(b) and subsection 5(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints John Nugent of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member of the Local Governance Commission, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of five years. 4. Under paragraph 5(1})(b) and subsection 5{3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Donna Redmond Gates of Quispamsis, New Brunswick, as a member of the Local Governance Commission, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of three years. -2- 82 5. Under section 8 of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council determines the remuneration for the Vice- Chairperson and members of the Local Governance Commission as follows: a) $200 for a day of four hours or more; b) $100 for a day of less than four hours; and c) $400 for a day when the Vice-Chairperson acts in absence of the Chairperson; or d) $200 for a day of less than four hours when the Vice-Chairperson acts in absence of the Chairperson. 6. Under section 8 of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council fixes the rate for reimbursement of expenses incurred by the Vice-Chairperson and members of the Local Governance Commission while acting on behalf of the Commission in accordance with Government of New Brunswick Administration Manual Policy AD-2801. Brenda L. name: The Hon. Judge Anne-Marie Jacques
body: 69 MARCH 28, 2024 2024-69 Under subsection 4.5(1) of the Provincial Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the Hon. Judge Anne-Marie Jacques of the Cour du Québec or, in her absence, illness or if she is unable to preside, another judge of the Cour du Québec, to preside over the matter of R v Serge René Guitard before the Provincial Court of New Brunswick, where: Serge René Guitard, between December 31, 2023 and January 4, 2024, both dates included, at or near Saint-Quentin, New Brunswick, a) did knowingly utter a threat to Luc Roy to cause death or bodily harm to him, thereby committing an indictable offence, contrary to paragraph 264.1(1)(a) and in violation of paragraph 264.1(2)(a) of the Criminal Code and amendments thereto; b = did knowingly cause Basile Chiasson to receive a threat to cause death or bodily harm to Luc Roy, thereby committing an indictable offence, contrary to paragraph 264.1(1)(a) and in violation of paragraph 264.1(2)(a) of the Criminal Code and amendments thereto; c) did, without lawful authority, engage in any conduct with the intention to provoke a state of fear in Luc Roy and Judge Suzanne Bernard, a justice system participant, in order to impede them in the performance of their duties, committing thereby an indictable offence, contrary to and in violation of paragraph 423.1(1)(b) of the Criminal Code and amendments thereto; -2- 69 d) while bound by a probation order made by a Provincial Court Judge on July 27, 2023, did fail, without reasonable excuse, to comply with a condition of that order, namely: “N’avoir aucun contact directement ou indirectement, avec Suzanne Bernard, Pierre Roussel et Marie- Philip Dumont et ne pas se rendre a sa/leurs résidence(s) ou lieu(x) d’emploi ” thereby committing an indictable offence, contrary to and in violation of paragraph 733.1(1}(a) of the Criminal Code and amendments thereto; e) while bound by a probation order made by a Provincial Court Judge on June 9, 2022, did fail, without reasonable excuse, to comply with a condition of that order, namely: “Vous ne devez pas communiquer, directement ou indirectement, avec Pierre Roussel et Suzanne Bernard et ne pas se rendre a sa/leurs résidence(s) ou lieu(x) de travail” thereby committing an indictable offence, contrary to and in violation of paragraph 733.1(1)(a) of the Criminal Code and amendments thereto; f) while bound by a probation order made by a Provincial Court Judge on October 8, 2021, did fail, without reasonable excuse, to comply with a condition of that order, namely: “S’abstenir de communiquer, directement ou indirectement, avec Suzanne Bernard, Pierre Roussel, c.r., Luc Roy, Shawn Beaulieu, Vanessa Nadeau, Maryléne Pilote, René Labbé, Eric Cormier” thereby committing an indictable offence, contrary to and in violation of paragraph 733.1(1)(a) of the Criminal Code and amendments thereto; -3- 69 g) while bound by a probation order made by a Provincial Court Judge on July 27, 2023, did fail, without reasonable excuse, to comply with a condition of that order, namely: “N’avoir aucun contact directement ou indirectement, avec Suzanne Bernard, Pierre Roussel et Marie- Philip Dumont et ne pas se rendre a sa/leurs résidence(s) ou lieu(x) d’emploi” thereby committing an indictable offence, contrary to and in violation of paragraph 733.1(1)(a) of the Criminal Code and amendments thereto; and h while bound by a probation order made by a Provincial Court Judge = on July 27, 2023, did fail, without reasonable excuse, to comply with a condition of that order, namely: “Shall keep the peace and be of good behaviour” thereby committing an indictable offence, contrary to and in violation of paragraph 733.1(1)(a) of the Criminal Code and amendments thereto. Brenda L. at tD Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 28 March 2024. Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet

name: Michel C. Leger
body: 58 MARCH 21, 2024 1. Under paragraph 2(1)(a) and subsection 3(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Michel C. Leger of Dieppe, New Brunswick, as Chair of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, effective May 6, 2024, for a term of seven years. 2. Under paragraph 58(1)(a) and subsection 60(1) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Michel C. Leger of Dieppe, New Brunswick, as Chair of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal, effective May 6, 2024, for a term of seven years. 3. Under subsection 4(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council determines remuneration to be paid to the Chair of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board in accordance with Step D, Level | of the Deputy Minister Pay Plan, effective May 6, 2024. 4, Under section 61 of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council determines remuneration to be paid to the Chair of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal in accordance with Step D, Level | of the Deputy Minister Pay Plan, effective May 6, 2024. 5. Under section 61 of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council fixes the rate of reimbursement of expenses incurred by the Chair while acting on behalf of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal in accordance with the Senior Executive Travel Directive of the Treasury Board, effective May 6, 2024. 58 6. Under paragraph 5(1)(a) and subsection 5(2) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Giselle Goguen of Fredericton, New Brunswick, effective April 1, 2024, for a term of seven years. 7. Under section 8 of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council determines the remuneration to be paid to the Chair of the Local Governance Commission in accordance with Step D, Level | of the Deputy Minister Pay Plan, and fixes the rate for reimbursement of expenses incurred by the Chair while acting on behalf of the Commission in accordance with the Senior Executive Travel Directive of the Treasury Board, effective April 1, 2024. 8. Under paragraph 2(1)(a) and subsection 3(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2024-44 dated February 29, 2024. 9. Under paragraph 5(1)(a) and subsection 5(2) of the Local Governance Commission Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2024-45 dated February 29, 2024. 10. Under subsection 4(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 2 of Order in Council 2001-504 dated November 2, 2001. position: Clerk of the Court of King’s Bench - Trial Division, Clerk of the Probate Court
body: 49 MARCH 12, 2024 1. Under subsection 68(1) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Pamela Bourque of Rothesay, New Brunswick, as a Clerk of the Court of King’s Bench ~— Trial Division, and Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District of Saint John, effective March 12, 2024. 2. Under subsection 68(1) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Sarah Hébert of Steeves Mountain, New Brunswick, as a Clerk of the Court of King’s Bench - Trial Division, and Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District of Moncton, effective March 12, 2024. 3. Under subsection 68(2) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Lindsay Genier of Grand-Bay Westfield, New Brunswick, as an Administrator of the Court of King’s Bench — Family Division, for the Judicial District of Saint John, effective March 12, 2024. 4, Under subsection 68(2) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Chantal Simpson of Riverview, New Brunswick, as an Administrator of the Court of King’s Bench — Family Division, for the Judicial District of Moncton, effective March 12, 2024. 5. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Mandy Guay of Oromocto, New Brunswick, as an Administrator of the Court of King’s Bench — Family Division, a Clerk of the Court of King’s Bench - Trial Division, and a Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District of Fredericton, effective March 12, 2024. -2- 6. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Stephene Baglole of Miramichi, New Brunswick, as an Administrator of the Court of King’s Bench — Family Division, a Clerk of the Court of King’s Bench - Trial Division, and a Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District of Miramichi, effective March 12, 2024. 7. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Johanne Gray-Godin of Bathurst, New Brunswick, as an Administrator of the Court of King’s Bench — Family Division, a Clerk of the Court of King’s Bench — Trial Division, and a Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District of Bathurst, effective March 12, 2024. 8. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Andrea Draper-Calhoun of Bedell, New Brunswick, as an Administrator of the Court of King’s Bench — Family Division, a Clerk of the Court of King’s Bench - Trial Division, and a Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District of Woodstock, effective March 12, 2024. 9. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes sections 1 and 3 of Order in Council 95-1070 dated November 23, 1995. 10. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph (a) of Order in Council 2002-101 dated March 14, 2002. 11. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Sections 2 and 3 of Order in Council 2012-266 dated August 14, 2012. 12. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2013-94 dated March 20, 2013. 13. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2003-107 dated April 17, 2003. 14. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes sections 4, 6, and 8 of Order in Council 2018-369 dated December 5, 2018. 15. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes sections 2, 3, and 4 of Order in Council 2023-137 dated June 22, 2023. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Johanne Gray-Godin of Bathurst, New Brunswick, as an Administrator of the Court of King’s Bench — Family Division, a Clerk of the Court of King’s Bench — Trial Division, and a Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District of Bathurst, effective March 12, 2024. 8. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Andrea Draper-Calhoun of Bedell, New Brunswick, as an Administrator of the Court of King’s Bench — Family Division, a Clerk of the Court of King’s Bench - Trial Division, and a Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District of Woodstock, effective March 12, 2024. 9. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph (a) of Order in Council 2002-101 dated March 14, 2002. 11. body: 50 MARCH 12, 2024 2024-50 1. Under subsections 7(1), 7(2) and 7(4) of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Mark Dykeman of Woodstock, New Brunswick, as a trustee of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation, as a nominee of the New Brunswick Libraries Board, effective March 12, 2024, for a term of three years. 2. Under subsections 7(1), 7(2) and 7(4) of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Mark Glass of Sisson Ridge, New Brunswick, as a trustee of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation, as a nominee of the New Brunswick Libraries Board, effective March 12, 2024, for a term of three years. name: Bev Bacon
body: 43 FEBRUARY 29, 2024 2024-43 1. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Jan Rademaker of Grand Falls, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, effective February 29, 2024, for a term of three years. 2. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Brian McCullum of Pearsonville, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, effective February 29, 2024, for a term of three years. 3. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Bev Bacon of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, effective Februar29y, 2024, for a term of three years. 4. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Benson Milner of Pointe-du-Chéne, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, effective February 29, 2024, for a term of three years. 5. Under subsections 3(1), 3({2) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Cathy LaRochelle of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, and designates her as Chair, effective February 29, 2024, for a term of three years. name: Stephen Manuel
body: 32 FEBRUARY 15, 2024 1. Under paragraph 31(1)(e) and subsection 32(1) of the Control of Municipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council declares that the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges is subject to the prov isions of Part V of the Control of Municipalities Act. 2. Under subsections 32(1) and 33(1) of the Control of Municipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Stephen Manuel of Ritchie, New Brunswick, as the Supervisor of the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges and vests in the Supervisor control and charge over the administration of all of the affairs of the local government, and all of those powers conferred upon a Supervisor pursuant to Pajt V of the Control of Municipalities Act, effective February 16, 2024. 3. Under section 44 of the Control of M lunicipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council gives approval to Stephen Manuel, Supervisor of the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges, to take full charge and control over all money belonging to the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges and received by any person for or on its behalf, and to sign all cheques drawn and issued by the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges and to authorize a person to countersign such cheques. 32 5. Under paragraph 31(1)(e), subsections 32(1) and 33(1), and sections 34, 38 and 44 of the Control of Municipalities Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2023-193 dated September 13, 2023, effective|February 16, 2024. As. name: Chantal LaFleur
body: 13 JANUARY 25, 2024 1. Under subsection 8(1.02) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council receives a description of the skills and qualifications required of the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission as a whole for the board to carry out its functions, and the skills and qualifications required for the position to be filled. 2. Under paragraph 8(1.03)(e) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council receives a description of the recruitment, assessment and selection process used and the result of those processes. 3. Under paragraphs 8(1)(b) and 8(1.03)(a) and subsections 9(2) and 9(5) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Michael MacMullin of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member representing workers on the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 4. Under paragraphs 8(1)(b) and 8(1.03)(a) and subsection 9(2) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Chantal LaFleur of Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member representing workers on the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of five years. -2- 13 5. body: 14 JANUARY 25, 2024 1. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(a) and subsection 21(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council reappoints Johanne Thériault-Paulin of Bathurst, New Brunswick, as Chair of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 2. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(b) and subsection 21(4) of the New Brunswick Regulation 2008-4, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council reappoints Bert Cyr of Dieppe, New Brunswick, as a Vice-Chair of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, representing the English language, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 3. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(b) and subsection 21(4) of the New Brunswick Regulation 2008-4, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council reappoints Andrée Poitras of Grand Falls, New Brunswick, as a Vice-Chair of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, representing the French language, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 4, Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1})(c) and subsection 21(4) of the New Brunswick 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Chery! Richardson of Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board of Teacher Certification, to represent anglophone teachers, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 14 5. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(c) and subsection 21(4) of the New Brunswick 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Ellen Culbert of Woodstock, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board of Teacher Certification, to represent anglophone teachers, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 6. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(c) and subsection 21(4) of the New Brunswick 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant-Governor -in Council reappoints Laurie LaForge of Grand Falls, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board of Teacher Certification, to represent anglophone teachers, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 7. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(d) and subsection 21(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Héléne Savoie Chouinard of Kedgwick, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, to - represent francophone teachers, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 8. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(d) and subsection 21(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Marie-Claude Imough of Beresford, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, to represent francophone teachers, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 14 9. name: Joel Dickinson
body: 18 JANUARY 25, 2024 2024-18 1. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Cade Libby as Deputy Minister of Natural Resources and Energy Development, effective January 29, 2024. 2. Under subsection 3(1) of the Regional Development Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Joel Dickinson as President of the Regional Development Corporation, effective January 29, 2024. 3. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and section 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council amends Order in Council 2023-132 dated June 15, 2023 by removing the word “Acting” where it appears therein, effective January 29, 2024. 4, Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and sections 26 and 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2023-210 dated October 5, 2023. Aut Brenda L. Rha. Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 25 January 2024. Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet

name: Bert Cyr
body: 14 JANUARY 25, 2024 1. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(a) and subsection 21(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council reappoints Johanne Thériault-Paulin of Bathurst, New Brunswick, as Chair of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 2. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(b) and subsection 21(4) of the New Brunswick Regulation 2008-4, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council reappoints Bert Cyr of Dieppe, New Brunswick, as a Vice-Chair of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, representing the English language, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 3. name: Michael MacMullin
body: 13 JANUARY 25, 2024 1. Under subsection 8(1.02) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council receives a description of the skills and qualifications required of the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission as a whole for the board to carry out its functions, and the skills and qualifications required for the position to be filled. 2. Under paragraph 8(1.03)(e) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council receives a description of the recruitment, assessment and selection process used and the result of those processes. 3. Under paragraphs 8(1)(b) and 8(1.03)(a) and subsections 9(2) and 9(5) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Michael MacMullin of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member representing workers on the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 4. Under paragraphs 8(1)(b) and 8(1.03)(a) and subsection 9(2) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Chantal LaFleur of Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member representing workers on the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of five years. -2- 13 5. Under paragraphs 8(1)(c) and 8(1.03){b) and subsection 9(2) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Gaétan Guérette of Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member representing employers on the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of five years. De Mmpry Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 25 January 2024. Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet

name: Gordie Lavoie
position: Vice-Chair of the Board of Directors
body: 239 DECEMBER 7, 2023 2023-239 1. Under subsection 8(5) of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of a description of the skills and qualifications required of the Board of Directors of Opportunities New Brunswick as a whole in order for the Board of Directors of Opportunities New Brunswick to carry out its functions, and the skills and qualifications required of nominees for the Board positions to be filled. 2. Under paragraph 8(6)(c) of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of a description of the recruitment, assessment and selection processes and the results of those processes. 3. Under paragraph 8(1)(c) and subsections 8(3) and 9(1) of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Andrew McLaughlin of Dieppe, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Directors of Opportunities New Brunswick, effective December 7, 2023, for a term of three years. 239 4. Under paragraph 8(1)(c) and subsections 8(3) and 9(1) of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Gilles Cormier of Riverview, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Directors of Opportunities New Brunswick, effective December 7, 2023, for a term of three years. 5. Under section 10 of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints current member, Gordie Lavoie of Miramichi, New Brunswick, as Vice-Chair of the Board of Directors of Opportunities New Brunswick, effective December 7, 2023, for aterm ending August 24, 2024. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 7 December 2023. name: Greg Lutes
body: 193 SEPTEMBER 13, 2023 2023-193 1. Under paragraph 31(1)(e) and subsection 32(1) of the Control of Municipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council declares that the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges is subject to the provisions of Part V of the Control of Municipalities Act. 2. Under subsections 32(1) and 33(1) of the Control of Municipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Greg Lutes of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as the Supervisor of the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges and vests in the Supervisor control and charge over the administration of all of the affairs of the local government, and all of those ‘powers conferred upon a Supervisor pursuant to Part V of the Control of Municipalities Act, effective September 16, 2023. 3. Under sections 34 and 38 of the Control of Municipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council gives approval and directs the Supervisor to: a) retain an inspector to investigate the affairs of the local government and make a report to the Commissioner of Municipal Affairs recommending actions required for the council to return to carrying on its business; and b) review the procedural and governance related by-laws and make such amendments to those by-laws as are required to assist the local government to return to normal functioning. -2- 193 4. Under section 44 of the Control of Municipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council gives approval to Greg Lutes, Supervisor of the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges, to take full charge and control over all money belonging to the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges and received by any person for or on its behalf, and to sign all cheques drawn and issued by the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges and to authorize a person to countersign such cheques. 5. Under paragraph 31(1)(e), subsections 32(1) and 33(1), and sections 34, 38 and 44 of the Control of Municipalities Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2023-174 dated July 25, 2023, effective September 16, 2023. Brenda L. Moma Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Goyemor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutengnt Vvern dee) Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 13 September 2023. Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet

name: Francois Carrier
body: 182 AUGUST 22, 2023 2023-182 1. Under subsection 3(1) of the Expropriation Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Francois Carrier of Edmundston, New Brunswick, as the Expropriations Advisory Officer, effective August 22, 2023, for a term of three years. 2. Under subsection 3(2.1) of the Expropriation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council determines the annual salary of the Expropriations Advisory Officer to be equivalent to the hourly rate of $250, a monthly retainer fee of $1000, and fix reimbursement for incurred expenses in accordance with New Brunswick Government Travel Directive AD-2801. name: Robert Haché
body: 170 JULY 25, 2023 2023-170 1. Under paragraph 60(a), subsection 63(1}, and section 62 of the Seafood Processing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries, appoints James Mockler of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Licensing and Penalty Appeal Board, representing a person employed in the department, and appoint him as Chair, effective July 25, 2023, for a term of two years. 2. Under paragraph 60(b) and subsection 63(2) of the Seafood Processing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on _ the recommendation of the Minister of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries, appoints Jean Lanteigne of Bas-Caraquet, New Brunswick, as a member of the Licensing and Penalty Appeal Board, representing the seafood industry, effective July 25, 2023, for a term of two years. 3. Under paragraph 60(c) and subsection 63(2) of the Seafood Processing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries, appoints Jean-Michel Michaud of Saint-Jacques, New Brunswick, as a member of the Licensing and Penalty Appeal Board, effective July 25, 2023, for a term of two years. 4. Under paragraph 61(1)(a) and subsection 63(2) of the Seafood Processing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries, appoints Annie Ferguson of Paquetville, New Brunswick, as an alternate member of the Licensing and Penalty Appeal Board, representing a person employed in the department, effective July 25, 2023, for a term of two years. 170 5. Under paragraph 61(1)(b) and subsection 63(2) of the Seafood Processing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on _ the recommendation of the Minister of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries, appoints Robert Haché of Alcida, New Brunswick, as an alternate member of the Licensing and Penalty Appeal Board, representing the seafood industry, effective July 25, 2023, for a term of two years. 6. Under paragraph 61(1)(c) and subsection 63(2) of the Seafood Processing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries, appoints Guylaine Savoie of Alcida, New Brunswick, as an alternate member of the Licensing and Penalty Appeal Board, effective July 25, 2023, for a term of two years. rox ant Brenda L. name: Michael Blaney
body: 174 JULY 25, 2023 2023-174 1. Under paragraph 31(1)(e) and subsection 32(1) of the Control of Municipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council declares that the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges is subject to the provisions of Part V of the Control of Municipalities Act. 2. Under subsections 32(1) and 33(1) of the Control of Municipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Michael Blaney of Gagetown, New Brunswick, as the Supervisor of the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges, and vests in the Supervisor control and charge over the administration of all of the affairs of the local government, and all of those powers conferred upon a Supervisor pursuant to Part V of the Control of Municipalities Act. 3. Under section 34 and 38 of the Control of Municipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council gives approval and directs the Supervisor to: a) retain an inspector to investigate the affairs of the local government and make a report to the Commissioner of Municipal Affairs recommending actions required for the council to return to carrying on its business; and b = review the procedural and governance related by-laws and make such amendments to those by-laws as are required to assist the local government to return to normal functioning. 174 4. Under section 44 of the Control of Municipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council gives approval to Michael Blaney, Supervisor of the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges, to take full charge and control over all money belonging to the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges and received by any person for or on its behalf, and to sign all cheques drawn and issued by the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges and to authorize a person to countersign such cheques. Brenda L. “ant FY Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 25 July 2023. Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet

name: Charbel Awad
body: 164 JUNE 29, 2023 2023-164 1. Under subsection 2(1) of the Municipal Capital Borrowing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Charbel Awad of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member and designates him as Chairman of the Municipal Capital Borrowing Board, effective immediately. 2. Under subsection 2(1) of the Municipal Capital Borrowing Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 3 of Order in Council 2020-265 dated December 3, 2020. 3. Under subsection 2(1) of the Municipal Capital Borrowing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Alex Berry of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Municipal Capital Borrowing Board, effective immediately. 4. Under subsection 2(1) of the Municipal Capital Borrowing Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 2 of Order in Council 2018-118 dated April 11, 2018. 5. Under section 2 of the Control of Municipalities Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Charbel Awad of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as the Commissioner of Municipal Affairs, effective immediately. 164 6. Under section 2 of the Control of Municipalities Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 1 of Order in Council 2020-265 dated December 3, 2020. Brenda L. name: Mike Legere
position: Member representing the forest industries of New Brunswick
body: 138 JUNE 22, 2023 2023-138 1. Under paragraphs 3(1)(a) and 3(2)(b) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints, on the recommendation of the Minister of Natural Resources and Energy Development, Brian Mosher of Grand Bay-Westfield, New Brunswick, as Chair of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, effective July 12, 2023, for a term of five years. 2. Under paragraphs 3(1)(c) and 3(2)(a) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Mike Legere of Fredericton, New Brunswick, to the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, as a member representing the forest industries of New Brunswick, effective June 22, 2023, for a term of three years. 3. Under paragraphs 3(1)(b) and 3(2)(a) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Susan Willis of New Market, New Brunswick, to the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, as a member representing producers, effective June 22, 2023, for a term of three years. name: Rena Levesque
body: 137 JUNE 22, 2023 2023-137 1. Under section 61 and subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Rena Levesque of Dieppe, New Brunswick, as Deputy Registrar of the Court of King’s Bench of New Brunswick, effective June 22, 2023. 2. Under section 61 and subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Rena Levesque of Dieppe, New Brunswick, as Clerk of the Court of King’s Bench — Trial Division for the judicial district of Moncton, effective June 22, 2023. 3. name: Chantal Moreau
body: 136 JUNE 22, 2023 2023-136 1. Under subsection 18(1) of the Small Claims Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Chantal Moreau of Moncton, New Brunswick, as an Adjudicator, effective June 22, 2023, for a term of 10 years. 2. Under subsections 56.5(1) and 56.5(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Chantal Moreau of Moncton, New Brunswick, as an Emergency Adjudicative Officer, effective June 22, 2023, for a term of 10 years. 3. Under subsection 56.1(1) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Chantal Moreau of Moncton, New Brunswick, as a Case Management Master for the Judicial District of Miramichi, effective June 22, 2023, for a term of three years. - 4. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(3) of the Small Claims Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph 2(b) of Order in Council 2019-228 dated November 14, 2079. 5. Under subsections 56.5(1) and 56.5(5) of the Judicature Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 16 of Order in Council 2018-864 dated March 14, 2018. 136 6. Under subsections 56.1(1) and 56.1(5) of the Judicature Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph 2(b) of Order in Council 2021-5 dated January 14, 2021. name: Traci Simmons
body: 121 JUNE 15, 2023 2023-121 1. Under subsection 15(6) of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of the skills and qualification requirements for nominees for the position of Chief Executive Officer of Opportunities New Brunswick. 2. Under paragraph 15(7)(c) of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of a description of the recruitment, assessment and selection processes used in making nominations for the position of the Chief Executive Officer of Opportunities New Brunswick, and the results of those processes. 3. Under subsection 15(3) of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Traci Simmons of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as Chief Executive Officer of Opportunities New Brunswick, effective June 15, 2023, for a term ending October 19, 2027. 4. Under subsection 15(5) of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council determines the remuneration of the Chief Executive Officer of Opportunities New Brunswick at an annual salary equivalent to Step E, Level Il of the Deputy Head Pay Plan, retroactive to October 20, 2022. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Councit of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil . Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 15 June 2023. Cho Unase Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet

name: Jocelyn Chan
position: member of the Board of Governors
body: 123 JUNE 15, 2023 2023-123 1. Under paragraph 9(3)(a) and subsection 11(1) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Catherine Lawrence of Mactaquac, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the New Brunswick Community College (NBCC), as a person nominated by the Board, effective July 2, 2023, for a term ending June 30, 2026. 2. Under paragraph 9(3){a) and subsection 11(1) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Jocelyn Chan of Moncton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the New Brunswick Community College (NBCC), as a person nominated by the Board, effective July 2, 2023, for a term ending June 30, 2026. 3. Under paragraph 9(3)(a) and subsection 11(1) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Nicole Gionet of Dieppe, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the New Brunswick Community College (NBCC), as a person nominated by the Board, effective July 2, 2023, for a term ending June 30, 2026. 4. Under paragraph 9(3)(b) and subsection 11{1) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Shawn Mesheau of Sackville, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the New Brunswick Community College (NBCC), as a person nominated by the Minister of Post-Secondary Education, Training and Labour, effective July 2, 2023, for a term ending June 30, 2026. -2- 123 5. Under paragraph 9(3)(b) and subsection 11(8) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Samar Shoaib of New Maryland, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the New Brunswick Community College (NBCC), as a person nominated by the Minister of Post-Secondary Education, Training and Labour, effective June 8, 2023, for a term ending August 10, 2024. 6. Under paragraph 9(3)(b) and subsection 11(8) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Scott Grant of Riverview, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the New Brunswick Community College (NBCC), as a person nominated by the Minister of Post-Secondary Education, Training and Labour, effective June 8, 2023, for a term ending August 10, 2024. 7. Under paragraph 9(3)(b) and subsection 11(1) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Wes McLean of Perth-Andover, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the New Brunswick Community College (NBCC), as a person nominated by the Minister of Post-Secondary Education, Training and Labour, effective July 1, 2023, for a term of three years. AR~M4-~p4 Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the ; de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 15 June 2023. " _/ Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet

name: Diane Botelho
body: 114 MAY 25, 2023 2023-114 1. Under subsection 12(4) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of a description of the requirements for nominees for the position of Executive Director of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council. 2. Under paragraph 12(5)(c) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of a description of the recruitment, assessment and selection process used in making nominations for the position of Executive Director of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, and the results of those processes. 3. Under subsections 12(2) and (3) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Diane Botelho of Oromocto, New Brunswick, as the Executive Director of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, effective May 25, 2023, for a term of five years. 4. Under subsection 13(5) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council fixes the annual remuneration of the Executive Director of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council at a maximum of $225,000.
